text: When I notice doubts about parenting readiness, I recognize them and choose to understand what they're telling me.
During moments when I think about raising a child, I notice my emotional state and choose to assess my readiness honestly.
When I feel concern about not being emotionally prepared, I notice it and choose to work on building readiness instead.
I let doubts about emotional preparation prevent me from identifying and developing readiness for parenting.
When I notice readiness for parenting building, I recognize it and choose to develop the emotional skills needed.
I see when I'm not emotionally prepared, and I choose to understand and address what's missing.
When I feel the pull to avoid assessing my readiness, I notice it and choose to face the question honestly instead.
I let not being emotionally prepared prevent me from identifying and building readiness for raising a child.
When I notice readiness growing, I recognize it and choose to prepare myself emotionally for parenting.
I recognize when concerns about readiness come from fear rather than genuine unpreparedness, and I respond accordingly.
When I feel the urge to avoid thinking about parenting readiness, I notice it and choose to assess it honestly instead.
I let doubts about emotional preparation prevent me from preparing myself for parenting and raising a child.
When I notice patterns that support parenting, I recognize them and choose to strengthen my emotional readiness.
I see when I'm ready for parenting, and I choose to build the emotional foundation needed for raising a child.
When I feel the pull to ignore readiness concerns, I notice it and choose to address them constructively instead.
I let not being emotionally prepared prevent me from identifying and developing readiness for parenting.
When I notice readiness for parenting, I recognize it and choose to develop the emotional capacity needed.
I recognize when readiness concerns are based on old patterns rather than present reality, and I choose to work through them.
When I feel the urge to avoid preparing for parenting, I notice it and choose to build emotional readiness instead.
I let not identifying my readiness prevent me from preparing myself emotionally for parenting and raising a child.
